004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
008import java.util.HashMap;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition;
011import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
012import java.util.function.Consumer;
013
014/**
015 * Connection listener. This calls back to a callback function when a connection change occurs. The
016 * callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use
017 * synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the callback function.
018 */
019public final class ConnectionListener implements AutoCloseable {
020  /**
021   * Create a listener for connection changes.
022   *
023   * @param inst Instance
024   * @param immediateNotify if notification should be immediately created for existing connections
025   * @param listener Listener function
026   */
027  public ConnectionListener(
028      NetworkTableInstance inst,
029      boolean immediateNotify,
030      Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener) {
031    s_lock.lock();
032    try {
033      if (s_poller == 0) {
034        s_inst = inst;
035        s_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createConnectionListenerPoller(inst.getHandle());
036        startThread();
037      }
038      m_handle = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledConnectionListener(s_poller, immediateNotify);
039      s_listeners.put(m_handle, listener);
040    } finally {
041      s_lock.unlock();
042    }
043  }
044
045  @Override
046  public synchronized void close() {
047    if (m_handle != 0) {
048      s_lock.lock();
049      try {
050        s_listeners.remove(m_handle);
051      } finally {
052        s_lock.unlock();
053      }
054      NetworkTablesJNI.removeConnectionListener(m_handle);
055      m_handle = 0;
056    }
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
061   *
062   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
063   */
064  public boolean isValid() {
065    return m_handle != 0;
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * Gets the native handle.
070   *
071   * @return Native handle
072   */
073  public int getHandle() {
074    return m_handle;
075  }
076
077  private int m_handle;
078
079  private static final ReentrantLock s_lock = new ReentrantLock();
080  private static final Map<Integer, Consumer<ConnectionNotification>> s_listeners = new HashMap<>();
081  private static Thread s_thread;
082  private static NetworkTableInstance s_inst;
083  private static int s_poller;
084  private static boolean s_waitQueue;
085  private static final Condition s_waitQueueCond = s_lock.newCondition();
086
087  private static void startThread() {
088    s_thread =
089        new Thread(
090            () -> {
091              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
092              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
093                try {
094                  WPIUtilJNI.waitForObject(s_poller);
095                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
096                  s_lock.lock();
097                  try {
098                    if (s_waitQueue) {
099                      s_waitQueue = false;
100                      s_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
101                      continue;
102                    }
103                  } finally {
104                    s_lock.unlock();
105                  }
106                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
107                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
108                  wasInterrupted = true;
109                  break;
110                }
111                for (ConnectionNotification event :
112                    NetworkTablesJNI.readConnectionListenerQueue(s_inst, s_poller)) {
113                  Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener;
114                  s_lock.lock();
115                  try {
116                    listener = s_listeners.get(event.listener);
117                  } finally {
118                    s_lock.unlock();
119                  }
120                  if (listener != null) {
121                    try {
122                      listener.accept(event);
123                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
124                      System.err.println(
125                          "Unhandled exception during listener callback: " + throwable.toString());
126                      throwable.printStackTrace();
127                    }
128                  }
129                }
130              }
131              s_lock.lock();
132              try {
133                if (!wasInterrupted) {
134                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyConnectionListenerPoller(s_poller);
135                }
136                s_poller = 0;
137              } finally {
138                s_lock.unlock();
139              }
140            },
141            "ConnectionListener");
142    s_thread.setDaemon(true);
143    s_thread.start();
144  }
145}
